headline: Amish Macaroni Salad
description: This Amish macaroni salad is made with hard-boiled eggs, bell pepper, onion, and celery, all tossed in a creamy, slightly sweet, and tangy dressing.

video.description: This salad is light and so delicious, the perfect summer side dish.
video.name: Amish Macaroni Salad

name: Amish Macaroni Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 small red bell pepper, seeded and chopped
2 cups creamy salad dressing (e.g. Miracle Whip)

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook elbow macaroni in boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain and set aside to cool.

Combine eggs, onion, celery, bell pepper, and relish in a large bowl. Stir together salad dressing, sugar, mustard, vinegar, celery seed, and salt in a small bowl. Pour over eggs and vegetables. Top with cooled macaroni; stir until well combined. Cover and chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour before serving.

review.reviewBody: I usually try to do exactly as printed - but with so many reviews saying to go easy on the sugar I ended up only putting in about 3 tablespoons and it was plenty! you can keep adding if needed. I also put in 1 1/2 cups of Miracle whip and 1/2 of mayo. It was delicious and taste even better the next day.
Delicious.
Very tasty. I recommend cutting back on sugar. I used half of recommended amount and it was still great.

I have made this salad several times, it is great but when the pasta was done cooking I put it in a bowl of cold water and let it sit in there until the pasta was completely cool and then added the rest of the ingredients.
Really tasty, A bit too sweet for me, I will reduce sugar next time I make it, but still very good.
This is the best pasta salad I've ever made. Followed the recipe just as written.

I used to think I had the best Mac salad recipe. That is until now! I would have given this 5 stars hands down except I adjusted the suger down to a quarter cup, used an entire box of elbows and used 4 eggs. I'm so glad I read the reviews before I made it. So good!!!
So light and refreshing but I only used half the sauce!
They loved it!
The sugar completely ruined this salad. I would not suggest using 2 cups of mayo for 2 cups of macaroni either.
Love it! Tastes even better the second day.

Awesome recipe!!! Enough said… A few tweaks that you may consider as well: Works well as Mac salad or potato salad You can use either relish depending on your taste for pickles sweet or dill Only add sugar at small intervals mixing well the recipe to my taste calls for a bit more then my taste likes. But all in all it’s awesome.
I made this for my wife and she said it was the best she has ever had.
Excellent
It was great
This is a delicious recipe
Excellent recipe. I was out of celery seed so I used a tiny bit of coriander and a tiny bit of garlic powder. I’ll definitely make this again!

I did use a 16 oz box of cellentani. After tasting the dressing, I thought the mustard was too much: it wasn't. Once you mix it in with the other ingredients it toned way down. I actually debated adding more, but added another teaspoon of vinegar instead (I did use apple cider veinegar). After chilling, I did add more mayo, but that was only needed because of the increased amount of pasta used.

This recipe turned out really good. I took the advice of other reviewers and cut the sugar back to 1/4 cup, used half mayo and half miracle whip, and doubled the amount of noodles I used. I also added cucumbers, green peppers, and green onion to the other vegetables. I might tweak it a little for a little more kick but I will definitely be using this as a base recipe again.
Leave the sugar out!
Spectacularly delicious. Made it once and husband is asking me to make it again. 5 stars!

This has got to be absolutely the BEST macaroni salad I’ve ever made! I did cut down on the sugar to about 1/4 cup, added an extra egg and a dash of garlic salt, but everything else as called for in the recipe. I highly highly recommend this to everyone!

We really like this recipe. I was out of dill pickle relish, so I chopped up a dill pickle and it worked just fine. Also instead of sugar, I substituted Truvia (Stevia) to help cut down on the sugar. Both substitutes weren’t noticed, which is a good thing.

I have made this 3 times. There is a possibility that if you use all mayonnaise, you might want some sugar, but if using Miracle Whip, that’s plenty sweet on its own. 1st time I followed the recipe exactly, except I used only ¼ cup sugar. Way too sweet. 2nd time I used ½ mayo, ½ Miracle Whip and ¼ cup sugar. Still way too sweet. 3rd time I used ½ mayo, ½ Miracle Whip and NO sugar, and this was good to us. The salad is begging for some color. I know the Amish don’t do this, but I threw in a tiny bit of chopped olives and a tiny bit of chopped parsley, just for color. If you want a complete meal from the leftovers, add a can of tuna to a bowlful for a delicious tuna salad.
excellent. Sweet, Creamy. Wife gives a 5 star!
This is perfect for our taste. I did omit the red pepper and the relish. Perhaps next time I will use less sugar. I thought it was a little too sweet. Delicious!
Lovely light salad. Family raved about it! No substitutions!!

I needed a quick macaroni salad recipe. Living in "amish country", this caught my eye. I used half again the amount of macaroni (3 cups total) and pretty much follow the recipe as is, except for the sugar. 3/4 of a cup of sugar sounded like WAY too much. I wish I'd read the reviews first to confirm that!! I ended up adding less than 1/4 cup and it still tasted too sweet. I'm wondering if this is a typo. I don't make desserts with that much sugar. Anyway, I tried to balance the sweetness with more egg and veggies. Otherwise, it's a great recipe, easy and uses ingredients I generally have on hand.
All time favorite and nothing else compares to this recipe!!!
Delicious ... didn't have pepper or celery seed. Only added 1/2 cup of sugar. We like it!
Too sweet for my husband, but I love it.
I love sweet Mac salad, but this was way to sweet. I’d only use 1/4 cup next time. Otherwise great recipe. I added hard boiled eggs too, just because I had an bunch.

This is really good! Only reason I didn't rate 5 stars is because I made some changes. Instead of celery I used carrots and instead of red bell pepper I used green. I also reduce sugar to 1/4 cup. My family loves it !

I think this is a good macaroni salad recipe. But I made a few changes. Instead of the 2 cups elbow macaroni I used 1 box (16oz) of macaroni. The second adjustment I made was I only did 3 tablespoons of sugar. The third adjustment is I used fat free/ light miracle whip to cut down the diary. Especially since my grandpa has been craving macaroni salad and he’s not supposed to have that much diary. The last adjustment I made was 4 eggs instead of 3. But this recipe was great and you can customize it.
Added 1/2 pound bacon cooked and chopped.
Just delicious! I added small cubed cheese to the list of ingredients. Winner!
This is a delicious recipe! It will definitely be one I will make time as time again.
very tasty
This is a great recipe. I did sub grey poupon For yellow mustard

This salad is delicious! I was never a fan of macaroni salad but the dressing in this recipe is sooo tasty. My wife loves this recipe and she is a life long fan of this type of salad. I did reduce the sugar but otherwise did not change a thing.

I swear, allrecipes seems to never fail. Made this a little while ago and tasted it before letting it sit/blend in the refrigerator. First taste reminded me of what Macaroni salad tasted back in the day. I will say I cut the measurements about a 1/4. And definitely cut the sugar down to about 2 tsp. I feel the Miracle Whip has just about enough sweetness anyway. Will be making this again for sure.
I made this and it was very good but I wish I had read the reviews first. Too much sugar! It was very sweet.

I made this recipe for Labor Day and everyone enjoyed it. I always complain about not liking macaroni salad. However, I would only purchase it from a particular food chain because I enjoyed the taste. No longer need to purchase from them because I’ve found my perfect recipe. You will enjoy this!

This macaroni salad was delicious. The only thing I did different was to decrease the sugar to 1/4 cup. Even then is was a little too sweet. Next time I will add only 3 TBSP of sugar Otherwise I loved it.

this was awesome. the only changes i made were not putting onions in and using only 1/3 cup sugar. it was a tad sweet so i will try 1/8 cup Splenda next time. one of the joys of diabetes is converting recipes. my husband hates onions so i will add some after he's done. he thought it was scandalous that i had made a pasta salad for dinner. l suddenly knew why I had those 2 lonely cans of crab in my pantry. it was very yummy and it offset the sweetness a bit.
Loved this macaroni salad. Liked the crunch of the celery and green pepper. Cut back on the sugar per other reviews. Perfect summer side. Served with bbq chicken. Will definitely make it again!

Typically if you are adding sugar and vinegar you'd be using mayonnaise, not Miracle Whip. Miracle Whip already has that in it, hence the tangy zip. This recipe is meant to be very sweet, so be aware of that and adjust accordingly. I used mayo and reduced the sugar by tasting as I mixed it. Also, how you prepare the macaroni matters a lot. If it is cooked al dente, it will be a smaller amount, cooked well done it will be a larger volume with the extra water it soaks up. According to Cook's Illustrated, overcooking macaroni is a good thing when making a mac salad---it soaks up the dressing better.

Made it for a cookout, everyone loved it. I did only use 1/4 cup of sugar as other reviewers had recommended. Otherwise, I followed the recipe exactly. For our family it is the perfect macaroni salad! Will add it to my "regulars"! Thanks for sharing.
This is the second time I made it and it was a hit both times!! LOVE it!!!! There does seem to be quite a bit of sauce so I added more DeCecco pasta.
I would make it again but would not put any sugar in it. I cut the sugar in half but I thought it still too sweet. Not sure why sugar would be an addition to any macaroni salad.

This is a staple summer salad for me. Clearly the Amish don't like wasting any time, though, as the sugar content in the original recipe looks like a dinner/dessert combo. Makes perfect sense, really, when you have a barn to raise and quilts to make--there's no time for dessert. Since I'm not as busy, I keep the two meals separate by cutting the sugar back to a tablespoon or two, and I use sweet pickle relish. Everything else I kept the same. I've made this ahead to take camping, and it tastes just as fresh the next day or two.
The REAL DEAL and perfect!

Normally if i change anything i don’t review the recipe. In this case i read most reviews that the recipe was too sweet so i did as most recommended and only used 1/4 cup of sugar. WOW this is sooo good. The best macaroni salad ever. Definitely a keeper!
Perfectly delicious!! I used 1/3c sugar as recommended by other reviews. Only had a green pepper on hand, but it didn’t hinder it at all.
always a barbecue hit! my husband's family raves over this mac salad at every get-together

This was a great recipe. After reading reviews I used maybe a 1/3 cup of sugar. I added a few tablespoons of mayo to balance out the miracle whip. Next time I’m going to try a cup of each. I used an 8oz box of macaroni noodles.
I made this for a family get together for the 4th of July and it was a hit.
This was delicious! It looked pretty and the taste was perfect. A little sweet but just enough . I’m not into macaroni salads made with Italian dressing so this was my kind of recipe.

Overall a solid tasty recipe! This was my first time making macaroni salad from scratch and I will be making it again. I reduced the sugar to an 8th of a cup , increased the vinegar based on our tastes, and doubled the noodles. Might go a little heavier on the veggies next time but that was my bad since I doubled the noodles and didn’t increase the veggies to make up for it.
Wow. A really great recipe. I used carrots instead of peppers. Best if allowed to chill overnight...IMO.
Always turns out delicious! Thank you for this recipe

I followed the recipe (mostly) the only modification was I decreased the amount of dressing. Although I have to admit it needed all of it. Was great after chilled but was much better the next day. New favorite

Seriously...I had not one, not two but three people asking me how I made this dish because it was THAT good. I only made it once, followed the recipe exactly and the result was gold. I think this was my favorite macaroni salad ever.

I follow exactly but after several times ..,sugar is way too much and Miracle whip is sweet anyway. 1/4 c is about all and maybe another mayo besides Miracle whip can work. You can add or delete what you want but than it’s not Amish macaroni salad. Stick to the recipe but cut down in sugar.
I brought the macaroni salad to a picnic and it was delicious. Friends had seconds and several people took some home with them. I shared the recipe which was super easy.
Recipe was accurate and delicious! Perfect for a family picnic.

I absolutely love Amish macaroni salad. I grew up on it living in Lancaster County. I only added 1/2 cup of sugar and taste perfect. I also added carrots and green pepper. I voided out relish and celery for I do not like those in my salad. Enjoy!

The only thing I changed was used 1/4 cup sugar as others had suggested. I was raised in Eastern Ohio amidst many Amish communities. This tasted very similar to what my mom made, though we are not Amish.

I followed some of the recommendations by others who made it, especially the reduction in the amount of sugar. I also left out the dill relish. I cut the recipe in half to suit the needs of a two person household, which resulted in a little guesswork as to amounts of certain ingredients. Didn't hurt the recipe a bit. This is one of those "adjust to suit yourself" recipes that you can't mess up.

I love this recipe. I make it for gatherings often and people comment that they normally do not like macaroni salad but that this one is very good. I agree. Can be a little sweet, adjust to your liking.
Way too sweet. Used 1/2 cup sugar and still way too sweet.

My family loves Amish macaroni salad. I decided to try to make it today. This recipe was perfect. I did add/change a few things.Are used olive oil mayonnaise instead of miracle whip. And I used 1/2 cup more because I like my dressing thicker. I didn’t have an onion, but I had a Shallot, so I use that instead.I added a tablespoon of rice vinegar as well as the 2 1/4 tablespoons of white vinegar. I also added chopped olives. My mother put olives in all of her picnic salads and this was a pleasant addition! Some said that that was too much sugar, but I used the three-quarter cups. Maybe the extra brine of the olives offset the flavor of the sugar, but the ratios were spot on. My wife loved it, and she’s an Amish salad aficionado, so I know this recipe is good!

I’ve made this many times. The thing most people don’t understand about this recipe is that Amish Macaroni or Potato Salads are supposed to be sweet! Leave it alone. This recipe is perfect just the way it is.
Used apple cider vinegar and left out the sugar

My co worker made this for a party. I loved it so had to make it for my family. This turned out awesome, my 31 year old son acted like it was the meal. My husband loves it . Every time I think I’ll have extra to share with my parents, it’s gone.

This recipe is great....if you reduce the sugar. This is my go to pasta salad...but I make a few changes. I use mayo instead of miracle whip. I also reduce the sugar to 1/8 of a cup, and I reduce the mustard to 2 Tbsp. The original recipe is WAY too sweet. I also like the way the salad looks with only 2 Tbsp of mustard. More creamy looking, instead of such a yellow tinge, but still has all the great flavour.

Just ok, but I think it could be great with some adjustments.... First, 1/2 cup of sugar was perfect. No more. Also, waaaaayyyy too much onion and mustard. Next time I’ll throw in only half of an onion and reduce mustard to 1 1/2 Tbsp. mustard. I would also reduce the celery seed to 1/4-1/2 tsp. Last, I would add at least one more egg, maybe more, and leave out the yolks. I think it has the potential to be really good with the adjustments!
too sweet. too soupy.

This turned out great! Exactly the flavor I was looking for. I did follow the advice of others and reduced my sugar to 1/4 cup and it was perfect. I also used about 3 cups of elbow macaroni as the dressing is a lot.
Delicious!!!
one of our favorites !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Love this simple recipe, with a few adjustments. I do not use sugar
Love this salad. Could eat the entire bowl by myself.

I did cut back on sugar to 1/4 cup, used garlic salt in place of the salt, and added an extra egg. Hubby agreed, this has got to be the BEST macaroni salad we’ve ever eaten! The left over salad was a bit dry the next day, so I made a half recipe of the dressing to bring it back to the all star status. Wish I could give it 10 stars! Yes, it is that good!

I cut the sugar down to 1/4 cup and that was still a bit too sweet for my taste.

I also cut the salad dressing down to 1 cup and that was about right.
I made exactly as per the recipe. JUST what I was looking for. Sweet balanced with some vinegar tartness. I'll be making it often. Thanks for sharing!
The family loved it. Gone in one day!
Everyone loved it. I did cut back on the sugar to half,also the mustard
This was SO good!! Based on other reviews, I used less than 1/3 cup of sugar and that worked well for our tastes.
Great recipe! Only had sweet pickle relish, so I cut back to 1/2 cup sugar. Tasted great..

Delicious Macaroni Salad! I have made this many, many times. My family loves it. The only change I make to the original is reduce the amount of sugar. It is a wonderful cool salad for a cook-out, with BBQ or fried chicken. This is reliable dish for zny potluck. I highly recommend!!
Best I've ever tasted!

I've made this twice. We LOVE it!!! My changes were to add 3 times the celery, 4 eggs , no bell pepper (spouse doesn't like them) and reduced the sugar to 1/3 cup. Next time I make it I will reduce mayo to 1 & 2/3 cup of mayo. It's a little too creamy with 2 cups.
Way too much miracle whip. Way too much sugar. Inedible waste of ingredients.
It is a bit too sweet so next time I will try it with half the sugar.
This is great. Love love love it! Perfect compliment to anything off the grill or out of the smoker.
It is an excellent recipe if you Chang the sugar to 1/4 cup. I also added half celery and half frozen peas . Turned out perfect.
Always a hit for a great summertime side dish. I don't use dill pickle relish, I use sweet, and then I cut back on the added sugar just slightly.
I use about a quarter cup of sugar. Other than that everyone I've shared this with loved it.
